New Records: India retained their 100% record in the Cricket World Cup 2023 after six games
Key Match Events: England's brittle batting was ruthlessly exposed by India's outstanding bowling and fielding
Jasprit Bumrah took 4 wickets for England, including golden ducks for Joe Root and Ben Stokes
Jos Buttler was dismissed for 23 runs, his longest innings since the opening game
Virat Kohli was dismissed for a 9-ball duck
Shubman Gill was bowled through the gate by Chris Woakes for 9 runs
Shreyas Iyer top-edged to mid-on off Woakes
Pre-Game Insights: England were motivated to avoid elimination and secure a spot in the next Champions Trophy
Post-Match Reflections: Matthew Mott rejected Eoin Morgan's claim of division in the England squad
Ben Stokes was criticized for his mindless batting, which contributed to England's collapse
India's captain Rohit Sharma was praised for his steady innings of 54 runs off 52 balls
Miscellaneous Highlights: England's bowlers were unrelenting and their fielding was full of commitment and quality
Virat Kohli attempted to drive David Willey through cover but was caught by Malan for 0
KL Rahul and Suryakumar Yadav contributed to India's steady innings
Others: The qualification process for the next Champions Trophy had been changed, and only the top seven teams in the group stage would be involved
